org.numenta.nupic.model

Class Synapse

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.numenta.nupic.model.Synapse
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<Synapse>, Persistable

    public class Synapse
extends java.lang.Object
implements Persistable, java.lang.Comparable<Synapse>
    Represents a connection with varying strength which when above a configured threshold represents a valid connection. IMPORTANT: For DistalDendrites, there is only one synapse per pool, so the synapse's index doesn't really matter (in terms of tracking its order within the pool). In that case, the index is a global counter of all distal dendrite synapses. For ProximalDendrites, there are many synapses within a pool, and in that case, the index specifies the synapse's sequence order within the pool object, and may be referenced by that index.
    Author:
    Chetan Surpur, David Ray
    See Also:
    DistalDendrite, Connections, Serialized Form

               Segment segment,
               int index,
               double permanence)
        Constructs a new Synapse for a DistalDendrite
        Parameters:
        sourceCell - the Cell which will activate this Synapse;
        segment - the owning dendritic segment
        pool - this Pool of which this synapse is a member
        index - this Synapse's index
        permanence -

      • Synapse

        public Synapse(Connections c,
               Cell sourceCell,
               Segment segment,
               Pool pool,
               int index,
               int inputIndex)
        Constructs a new Synapse
        Parameters:
        c - the connections state of the temporal memory
        sourceCell - the Cell which will activate this Synapse; Null if this Synapse is proximal
        segment - the owning dendritic segment
        pool - this Pool of which this synapse is a member
        index - this Synapse's index
        inputIndex - the index of this Synapse's input; be it a Cell or InputVector bit.
